channel.title: TGaceAllStories
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from TGaceAllStories, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Two Fed nowcasts are producing two entirely different views of economy
item.description: No fewer than three of the Fed’s regional central banks offer what are called “nowcasts” of GDP growth — and they all are telling very different stori...

item.title: ‘I am my mother’s caregiver’: My mom, 93, added my name to her retirement accounts. Will she qualify for Medicaid?
item.description: “Will Medicaid be able to take the money from her bank account?”

item.title: I’m 43 with $450K in my 401(k) and $270K in one company’s stock. Is this a risky plan?
item.description: “I have $60,000 in student debt, but no other debts. I also have $70,000 in high-yield savings.”

item.title: How one hedge fund investing in small caps surged 25% in July and doubled this year
item.description: Despite the impression that investing is only about the Mag7 these days, one hedge fund is beating the market in small caps

item.title: The jobs slowdown actually means the recession’s over, not starting, argues Morgan Stanley
item.description: Friday’s weak jobs data provided further proof that the U.S. is transitioning to an early-stage recovery, says Morgan Stanley strategists.

item.title: Why TJ Maxx is a winner as tariff-induced higher prices drive consumers to hunt for value
item.description: While off-price retailers as a group stand to gain in the current environment, investors highlighted TJ Maxx for its consistent and flexible product o...

item.title: Top Wall Street analysts prefer these 3 dividend-paying stocks for consistent income
item.description: TipRanks' ranking service highlights three dividend-paying stocks, including Archrock and Permian Resources.

item.title: Warren Buffett's likely exit from Kraft Heinz creates a big overhang for the underperforming mac-and-cheese stock
item.description: Kraft Heinz marked a rare blemish in Buffett's investment track record. Its shares have plunged nearly 70% since its merger in 2015.

item.title: Alphabet and these two other stocks are overbought with the market near all-time highs
item.description: The S&P 500 closed at a record on Thursday, as traders tied bets on risk assets to hopes for a September interest rate cut from the Federal Reserve.

item.title: Elliott's plan for PepsiCo includes investing in some of its iconic brands, shedding others
item.description: Elliott Investment Management says PepsiCo neglected its core soda brands and is selling way too many products.
